result.execSummary:
The defendant William D Eskridge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.
Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No illegally controlled substances.

Random screening.
Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 
Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharges, if not already done.
Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class I felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence. Defendant to apply for expungement within 60 days of termination of probation. 
Court advised the defendant he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Cognitive intervention program.

timeConds.notes: with work release for work and school.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William D Eskridge

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction - straight time - with 5 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) no illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA,  treatment or program; 6) obtain GED or HSED; 7) cognitive intervention program; 8) SERVE 30 DAYS at the House of Correction with work release for work and school.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.  

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class I felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.  Defendant to apply for expungement within 60 days of termination of probation.

Defendant William D Eskridge in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant William D Eskridge in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  William Berens, student, with William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant may benefit from monitoring through the Day Reporting Program which requires an assessment with that agency.  Defense is moving for an adjournment.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant William D Eskridge in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Kevin R. Shomin for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Court addresses the Justice Point report.  Defendant states he has only one phone in the household (mother's cell phone) and never received the message.  Court admonishes the defendant.  Case may be resolved with a possible deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant needs to be TAD evaluated.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Defendant William D Eskridge in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated February 12, 2014, received and filed.

Filed, Justice Point Report dated 1/28/14.
css

Defendant William D Eskridge in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Dennis Murphy for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William D Eskridge in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant William D Eskridge in custody.  Nicholas S. Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
